No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.

24.str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
24.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.

24.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

25.str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

25.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
25.str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
25.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

26.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
26.str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
A kiss. From phileo; a kiss.

27.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
27.str2: To adjure by, charge solemnly by. From horkos; to put on oath, i.e. Make swear; by analogy, to solemnly enjoin.

27.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
27.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

28.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

28.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
28.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

28.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
